dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form
Class AbstractWidgetController

java.lang.Object
  dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form.AbstractWidgetController
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractMementoWidgetController
public abstract class AbstractWidgetController
extends java.lang.Object

This is the controller interface for a guided config widget used for communication with the guided config engine.

A custom widget that wants to be controlled by the engine must register a subclass of AbstractWidgetController with the WidgetFactory: 

 MyWidget widget = ew MyWidget( parent );
 backend.getWidgetFactory().registerWidgetController( widget );

Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

Since:
2008.b

doCanShowMemento

public boolean doCanShowMemento(java.lang.String mementoPath)
Checks if this controller is responsible for the given memento.

This default implementation returns false.

Parameters:
mementoPath - The memento to show
Returns:
true if the widget is associated with the given memento id, false otherwise
Since:
2008.b

doCanShowWidget

public boolean doCanShowWidget(java.lang.String widgetId)
Checks if the controller manages the given widget.

The default implementation calls doGetWidgetIds() to find out which widgets are managed.

Parameters:
widgetId - The widget in question
Returns:
true if the controller mamanges this widget
Since:
2008.b

doLoadState

public void doLoadState(Memento memento)
Called to load the metadata like width, shown text format etc. of this widget.

The handed in memento is exclusivly created to store meta-data for a specific widget managed by this controller. One memento is created for each widget-id the controller manages. This method is called on startup of the wizard for each managed widget once, handing in a memento with the id of the widget.

The default implementation does nothing.

Parameters:
memento - the memento pointing to the metadata part of this widget
Since:
2008.b

doSaveState

public void doSaveState(Memento memento)
Called to save the metadata like width, shown text format etc. of this widget.

The handed in memento is exclusivly created to store meta-data for a specific widget managed by this controller. One memento is created for each widget-id the controller manages. This method is called on shut-down of the wizard for each managed widget once, handing in a memento with the id of the widget.

The default implementation does nothing.

Parameters:
memento - the memento poiting to the metadata part of this widget
Since:
2008.b

doUpdateData

public void doUpdateData()
Called to update the Mementos associated with this widgets, with the value from the widget.

The default implementation does nothing.

Since:
2008.b

doUpdateValidationResults

public void doUpdateValidationResults(java.util.List<ValidationResult> results)
Called to updates the error/warnings markers from a list of ValidationResults

The default implementation does nothing.

Parameters:
results - ValidationResults for which to show error or warning markers
Since:
2008.b

doUpdateView

public void doUpdateView(java.util.List<java.lang.String> changedMementos)
Called to update the widget with the value from the associated Memento.

The default implementation does nothing.

This method can use AbstractMementoWidgetController.mustUpdateView(List) to find out if it must make an update.

Parameters:
changedMementos - the mementoIds from which the GUI is to be updated (may be null for a complete refresh)
Since:
2008.b

doNavigate

public void doNavigate(java.lang.String widgetId,
                       java.lang.String mementoPath)
This method is called by the guided config engine to dispatch navigation events (set focus) to widgets managed by this controller.

Either widgetId or mementoPath may be null.

The default implementation does nothing.

Parameters:
widgetId - The widget to show (may be null)
mementoPath - The path to the widget to show (may be null)
Since:
2008.b

doChangeEnablement

public void doChangeEnablement(java.lang.String widgetId,
                               boolean enabled)
This method is called by the guided config engine to dispatch gui enable and disable events to the widgets managed by this controller.

The default implementation does nothing.

Parameters:
widgetId - The widget id to enable or disable
enabled - true to enable widget
Since:
2008.b

doGetWidgetIds

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> doGetWidgetIds()
Query the Widget-Ids of the widgets that are managed by this controller.

The default implemementation returns an empty list.

Returns:
All widget-ids of the controller (not null)
Since:
2008.b

doGetWidgetId

public java.lang.String doGetWidgetId()
Query the widget-id of the widget that is managed by this controller.

Normally a WidgetController manages a single widget. This method therefore is a convenience method to either query the widgetId of this single widget or the id of the first widget managed by the controller.

The default implementation returns the first widget id returned by doGetWidgetIds().

Returns:
the id of the widget managed by this controller or the one of the first if multiple widgets are managed
Since:
2009.a

doGetWidget

public ISWTWidget doGetWidget()
Get the widget (or the first one if the controller mamanges mutliple) the controller manages.

Note: Custom widgets implemented for EB tresos Studio 2008.b will return null.

Returns:
The widget or null if not known
Since:
2009.a

doGetWidgets

public java.util.List<ISWTWidget> doGetWidgets()
Get the widgets the controller manages.

Note: Custom widgets implemented for EB tresos Studio 2008.b will return an empty list.

Returns:
The widget or an empty list of unknown
Since:
2009.a

doWidgetIsDisposed

public void doWidgetIsDisposed()
Notify the controller that a widget controlled by this controller is disposed.

The default implementation calls WidgetFactory.unregisterWidgetController(AbstractWidgetController) if the controller manages only one widget, else it throws an exception.

Please override this method if the controller manages more than one widget.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the controller manages more than one widget.
Since:
11
